vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
νάρδος, ἡ,
spikenard, Nardostachys Jatamansi, [NT+4th c.BC+]; compare {ναρδόσταχυς}
__2 ν. Κελτική Celtic nard, Valeriana celtica, [Refs 1st c.AD+]
__3 ν. ὀρεινή or ὀρεία mountain nard, Valeriana Dioscoridis, [Refs 4th c.BC+]
__4 ν. Συριακή Syrian nard, Cymbopogon Iwarancusa, [Refs 1st c.AD+]
__5 νάρδου ῥίζα ginger grass, Cymbopogon Schoenanthus, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
__6 ν. ἀγρία, ={ἄσαρον}, [Refs 1st c.AD+]
__II oil of spikenard, [Refs 3rd c.BC+]. (Semitic word, cf. Bab. lardu.)
vocabInfos.shortDef: nard, the oil of (spike)nard, extracted from the root
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
nard, the oil of (spike)nard, extracted from the root
spikenard, ,a species of aromatic plant with grassy leaves and a fibrous root, of which the best and strongest grows in India; in NT oil of spikenard, an oil extracted from the plant, which was highly prized and used as an ointment either pure or mixed with other substances, Mk. 14:3; Jn. 12:3*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: aceite o perfume de nardo (una planta aromática)
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition: 甘松香,是一種芬芳的針葉植物,古人用來作油膏 (可 14:3; 約 12:3)
vocabInfos._zh_Definition: 甘松香,是一种芬芳的针叶植物,古人用来作油膏 (可 14:3; 约 12:3)
